metadata.title: CVE-2021-33631 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerability in openEuler kernel on Linux(filesystem modules) allows Forced Integer Overflow.This issue affectsopenEuler kernel: from 4.19.90 before 4.19.90-2401.3, from 5.10.0-60.18.0before 5.10.0-183.0.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33631` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-226-generic - 4.15.0-226.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-226-generic - 4.15.0-226.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-226-lowlatency - 4.15.0-226.238
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1153-kvm - 4.15.0-1153.158
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-aws - 4.15.0-1169.182
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1178-azure - 4.15.0-1178.193
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-gcp - 4.15.0-1163.180
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1132-oracle - 4.15.0-1132.143
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-226.238').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1').
